meanings.definition: Quippier (comparative adjective): More inclined to make witty remarks or jokes.
meanings.sent1: She became quippier as she gained confidence in her humor.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's quippier remarks always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: His quippier comments at the meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her quippier nature shone brightly in social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The quippier banter between friends was infectious.

meanings.definition: Quippier (adverb): In a manner that is more inclined to make witty remarks or jokes.
meanings.sent1: She spoke quippier than usual during the stand-up comedy show.
meanings.sent2: The comedian delivered his jokes quippier than before.
meanings.sent3: He answered the questions quippier than expected, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed quippier than the river's current.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere became quippier as the party went on.
